ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: It helped me review some of the material I had taken in Calc BC in high school.
I developed a great conceptual understanding of limits and derivatives, plus how to apply this understanding to questions.
Strong understanding of single-variable derivative calculus.
Basic calculus
Learned a lot on computing derivatives and using them to find other rates and solutions. Class was taught really well, and Giuseppe was a very good explaining every topic.

From this course, I developed a better understanding of the beginning of calculus I and was able to learn how to tackle larger word problems in addition to organizing a method to approaching problems that required multiple steps. I am also equipped to answer questions that range from sketching graphs with only certain given information, to finding the optimized area, to understanding the relationships between position, velocity, and acceleration. I learned many theorems that guide how I will look at math in the future and these theorems are now instituted in my mind.
Basic subjects of calculus, how to find the derivative of an equation and how to find the integral
Taking derivatives and advancing my math skills
problem-solving, patience
Mr. Giuseppe was such an encouraging and helpful MATH 112 instructor. I learned a lot of skills, information, and studying methods I hope to take away from this course.
My knoledge of calculus grew
I honed my problem-solving skills and learned how to think outside of the box when brainstorming problem-solving methods.
I developed calculus skills.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The practice exams seem to be far off than the actual test but there was sufficient time for exams. The way the material is taught ranges through different professors and I found the different approach very confusing at times. The class is twice a week but the time is longer than other courses, which for me was a distraction and focus issue. But the professors do want you to pass and is there for you during office hours.

Strengths: you very thoroughly cover rate of change and similar applications
Weaknesses: the class is not very engaging. There could be better activities in class that engage their students. Activities for Think-Pair-Share could be improved.
Taught well. Nice teacher.
It was structured
Tough course due to curriculum, tests seemed a bit tougher than psets and in class examples.

The strengths of this course was that it definitely prepared the student for the upcoming challenges they may face as a STEM major in terms of truly understanding the basis of calculus. In addition, the strengths this class presented was that it went over a lot of material within a short time, but this material was supplemented with good practice. The weakness of this course was that review session could have been a bit more informative in terms of what was gone over as usually the review sessions were just going over textbook questions.
I feel that this course was taught well and that there wasn't much else to do to improve it.
Lectures strictly in an a powerpoint format made it difficult to learn effectively. Peer tutoring system was very helpful.
I enjoyed the level of participation required in class.
Continuing to work on my studying techniques
weaknesses: word problems

My strengths of this course having some background information in Calc as well as my work ethic. However, being my first semester at Yale, I found it difficult to translate my knowledge on exams and felt like I was not performing my best on exam day.
Teaching in class wasnt very applicable to problem sets however it helped me learn the basics
The strengths were the high amount of review sessions and fairness of exams. Weaknesses were the lack of clarity in some instructors teaching and unclear feedback on problem sets.

The strengths of the course are the manageability of  the workload and exams. The weakness is the weight that exams have compared to the weekly problem sets. The course can fix it by making the problem sets and the exams weigh a more equal amount.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: This course is very proof based and not as straight forward as the material is, structured around reasoning and mathematical proofs/ theorems which was confusing. Take this course only if necessary, but if not, I would actually try on the placement exams and place out to Math 115 or above where it is just concept focused without much theorems and proofs.

Yes. It provides a good foundation for math derivative skills. It also does a good job leading you into Math 115 at the end of the course. It is definitely NOT a gut class and takes some work understanding the material.
Yes. Good foundational math class. Easy QR credit. Relatively fun.
Maybe
Yes, very good course to learn the fundamentals of calculus.

I would recommend this course to students who are looking to pursue a STEM major and do not have a solid calculus background. This is a good class to go over the foundations of understanding and becoming better equipped for harder math classes to come. This course is also facilitated by peer tutors and TAs that make the process of learning much easier.
I feel that I would recommend this class to another student the class was taught well and I didn't feel cheated.
Yes, a great introductory course for first years.
Yes, it was very good for teaching me the basics of advanced math in a good system.
Yes, improves your reasoning
I would recommend this course to other students because it was a fundamental course that allowed me to learn math skills as well as how to study for exams.
Yes
I would recommend this course to another student who needs to complete a math requirement or enjoys math.
Yes, it will teach you the basics of calculus that will set you up for math at Yale.
